TSU_SUB_W11_COMM_FLOWER_007.speaker: UI
TSU_SUB_W11_COMM_FLOWER_007.text: The flower bloomed, but something is off.

TSU_SUB_W11_COMM_AREATYPE_000_000.speaker: UI
TSU_SUB_W11_COMM_AREATYPE_000_000.text: The hour of drought has arrived.

TSU_SUB_W11_COMM_AREATYPE_000_003.speaker: UI
TSU_SUB_W11_COMM_AREATYPE_000_003.text: The hour of flood has arrived.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_000.text:
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator,
summoned from another world!
The maiden's trials are complete.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_010.text:
All that remains is to make the flower bloom.
Defeat Ancikar's fiends and turn Ancikar's
dreams into nutrients for the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_020.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_020.text:
Hail, Soyay the Pollinator,
summoned from another world! The festival of the Epuyke is complete,
and we are now preparing for the next
Maiden of the Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_030.speaker: Priestess of Imeru L
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_TIPS_000_CUT_000_030.text:
But while the flower blooms, the seed of the
next Epuyke cannot be returned to the earth.
Bring down Ancikar's fiends and prepare
to welcome the next Epuyke.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_000.text:
These are the testing fields,
and I am Kina the summoner.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_010.text:
You should battle the fiends I summon,
Soyay, for they bear no influence upon 
Ancikar. What say you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_030.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_030.text:
Would you like to battle
a summoned fiend?

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_070.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_070.text: Ma, Soyay tako! Ma, Soyay tako!

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_080.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_000_CUT_000_080.text:
If ever you change your mind,
you know where to find me.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_100_CUT_000_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_100_CUT_000_010.text:
You should battle the fiends I summon,
former Soyay, for they bear no influence
upon Ancikar. What say you?

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_100_CUT_010_000.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_100_CUT_010_000.text:
Where do the summoned fiends come from?
What sort of beings are they originally?
I am simply dying to know.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_100_CUT_010_010.speaker: Kikiris
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_BATTLE_100_CUT_010_010.text:
You will be returning to your world now,
yes, former Soyay? If so, I have decided
I am coming with you.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_060.text:
'For reasons unclear, I have been summoned to
this world by some sort of magic. I am apparently
meant to walk with someone labeled a 'maiden'
and aid her in a series of trials.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_070.text:
But I have only a few days supply
of both diapers and milk remaining,
and I don't know what to do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_100.text:
'I thought I might awake to find this had
all been a dream, but it was not to be.
Time is...strange here—fluid—which is why
I have decided to write all of this down.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_110.text:
The easiest way to return to my world is to abandon
the maiden, but I am torn as to whether or not that's
an ethical choice. I have no one I can talk to,
and I cannot leave Nana alone either.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_140.text:
I spoke to the clerics; the maiden's mother will look
after Nana while I'm off helping her daughter on the trials.
I know Nuy will not return home if I am successful,
and yet I still feel this is something I must do.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_190.text:
Today, I set out on my trials with the maiden, Nuy.
Her mother, Yuk, will be taking care of Nana while I'm
away—and even though Yuk's own daughter is going to
become the Epuyke, all she does is fuss over me and Nana.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_200.text:
I don't know much about this world,
but I do know this: Yuk is a good person—
I would lose my mind if someone told me
Nana had to become this Epuyke thing.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_210.text:
When these trials are over—when we return to our world and
Nana grows up—I'll tell her about what happened here. She'll probably think
I'm making it up, and I won't be able to blame her. Perhaps I'll even write a
book about this place one day—I imagine it would sell quite well.

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_220.text:
Oh, one last thing: I learned to say 'Epuyke nogonoa
kowo' in the local language. People say this to me
constantly, and it roughly means, 'May the blossoms
of the Epuyke watch over you.'

SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.speaker: Hasumi
SUB_W11_EVAR_COMM_KIERU_310_CUT_010_230.text:
Well, it's time for me to go.
Epuyke nogonoa kowo, my precious Nana.'
